info.name: openEHR Course
info.description:
This is a collection of API calls provided as part of the [Apperta C4H Platform](https://platfrom.code4health.org) which represent two common openEHR CDR REST APIs -  the Better Ehrscape API and the formal openEHR REST API.

The collection is designed to run in parallel with Apperta C4H Platform Postman Environments, which supply the appropriate baseURLs and authentication variables. In some cases, environment variables are automatically updated by the results of requests.

 - The official [openEHR REST API](https://specifications.openehr.org/releases/ITS-REST/latest/index.html) is gradually superceding various similar vendor-specifc REST APIs. This is currently supported by Better, DIPS. Code24 and EhrBase.The `openehrBaseURL` environment variable is used to point to the openEHR REST API endpoint of the CDR, if this is supported, otherwise this will be `null`.

- The proprietary [Better Ehrscape API](https://www.ehrscape.com/api-explorer.html), also largely supported by [EtherCIS](https://ripple.foundation/ethercis/). It includes some API calls which are currrently only supported by Better but is broadly aligned to the official openEHR REST API. The `ehrscapeBaseURL` environment variable is used to point to the Ehrscape REST API endpoint of the CDR, if this is supported, otherwise this will be `null`.


## Authorization

Current CDRs may have slightly different approaches to authorization. 


### Better/ EhrBase

Better and EHrBase CDRs use a Basic Auth string passed via the `Authorization` header, which also acts as a route to the appropriate CDR domain in multiple-domain CDRs such as the Apperta C4H platform. Basic Auth would normally only be used for development and testing, with something like Bearer Token Authorisation used in production.

### EtherCis 

EtherCis instances currently require an `Ehr-Session` variable to be set in the header prior to other calls being made, via the ` POST /session | Create Session |` call. This will update the required environment variable. Better CDR supports BasicAuth and setting an `Ehr-Session` is not required.

item.name: Check the CDR connection - fetch a list of templates

request.description:
openEHR templates are aggregations of logical archetype models that along with the basic Reference model, act as the validation schema for any patient data submitted to the CDR. 

You cannot submit any information to a CDR without first registering the template which will be used to validate it.

This section will test our connection to the CDR by running a `GET /template` call.

#### Response

A successful call will return `200` and a list of registered templates.

### Troubleshooting

If you are unable to retrieve the list of templates, ensure that you are using the correct URL for the endpoint, and the correct `Authorization` header for your chosen CDR.

If you are working within Postman, make sure that you have a valid Environment loaded as the collection uses that to set the correct `Username` and `Password` variables to generate a Basic Auth `Authorization' header, and also sets the correct `ehrscapeBaseUrl' and `openehrBaseUrl` URLs.

request.description:
Create a new EHR object by sending a subjectID and subjectNamespace in the EHR_STATUS object.

The Pre-request correctly formats the EHR_STATUS, depending on the cdrProduct.

                                        <term_definitions code="at0000">
                                            <items id="text">Cancer diagnosis</items>
                                            <items id="description">Local cluster to capture specific details (not available elsewhere) for cancer diagnosis in Genomics England Cancer datasets.</items>
                                        </term_definitions>
                                        <term_definitions code="at0001">
                                            <items id="text">Morphology</items>
                                            <items id="description">The morphology code for the diagnosed cancer as defined by ICDO3 or SNOMED CT or SNOMED RT. Terminology mappings should be used.</items>
                                            <items id="comment">The SNOMED version should be captured as part of the code string.</items>
                                        </term_definitions>
                                        <term_definitions code="at0002">
                                            <items id="text">Topography</items>
                                            <items id="description">The topography code for the diagnosed cancer as defined by ICDO3 or SNOMED CT or SNOMED RT. Terminology mappings should be used.</items>
                                            <items id="comment">The SNOMED version should be captured as part of the code string.</items>
                                        </term_definitions>
                                        <term_definitions code="at0013">
                                            <items id="text">Recurrence indicator</items>
                                            <items id="description">An indication of whether a diagnosis of recurrence has been recorded for which a new Cancer Care Plan is required.</items>
                                        </term_definitions>
                                        <term_definitions code="at0014">
                                            <items id="text">YL</items>
                                            <items id="description">Yes, including local recurrence.</items>
                                        </term_definitions>
                                        <term_definitions code="at0015">
                                            <items id="text">YD</items>
                                            <items id="description">Yes, not including local recurrence.</items>
                                        </term_definitions>
                                        <term_definitions code="at0016">
                                            <items id="text">NN</items>
                                            <items id="description">No, not recurrence.</items>
                                        </term_definitions>
                                        <term_definitions code="at0017">
                                            <items id="text">Metastatic site</items>
                                            <items id="description">The site of the metastatic disease, if any, at diagnosis.</items>
                                        </term_definitions>
                                        <term_definitions code="at0018">
                                            <items id="text">02 Brain</items>
                                            <items id="description">Metastatic disease is located in the brain.</items>
                                        </term_definitions>
                                        <term_definitions code="at0019">
                                            <items id="text">03 Liver</items>
                                            <items id="description">Metastatic disease is located in the liver.</items>
                                        </term_definitions>
                                        <term_definitions code="at0020">
                                            <items id="text">04 Lung</items>
                                            <items id="description">Metastatic disease is located in the lung.</items>
                                        </term_definitions>
                                        <term_definitions code="at0021">
                                            <items id="text">06 Multiple metastatic sites</items>
                                            <items id="description">Metastatic disease is located in multiple sites.</items>
                                        </term_definitions>
                                        <term_definitions code="at0022">
                                            <items id="text">07 Unknown metastatic site</items>
                                            <items id="description">The site of metastatic disease is unknown.</items>
                                        </term_definitions>
                                        <term_definitions code="at0023">
                                            <items id="text">08 Skin</items>
                                            <items id="description">Metastatic disease is located in the skin.</items>
                                        </term_definitions>
                                        <term_definitions code="at0024">
                                            <items id="text">09 Distant lymph nodes</items>
                                            <items id="description">Metastatic disease is located in distant lymph nodes.</items>
                                        </term_definitions>
                                        <term_definitions code="at0025">
                                            <items id="text">10 Bone (excluding Bone Marrow)</items>
                                            <items id="description">Metastatic disease is located in the bone excluding bone marrow.</items>
                                        </term_definitions>
                                        <term_definitions code="at0026">
                                            <items id="text">11 Bone marrow</items>
                                            <items id="description">Metastatic disease is located in the bone marrow.</items>
                                        </term_definitions>
                                        <term_definitions code="at0027">
                                            <items id="text">99 Other metastatic site</items>
                                            <items id="description">Metastatic disease is located in another site.</items>
                                        </term_definitions>
                                        <term_definitions code="at0028">
                                            <items id="text">Tumour laterality</items>
                                            <items id="description">Tumour laterality identifies the side of the body for a tumour relating to paired organs within a PATIENT based on the evidence from a pathological examination.</items>
                                        </term_definitions>
                                        <term_definitions code="at0029">
                                            <items id="text">Bilateral</items>
                                            <items id="description">The tumour is situated on both sides of the body.</items>
                                        </term_definitions>
                                        <term_definitions code="at0030">
                                            <items id="text">Right</items>
                                            <items id="description">The tumour is situated on the right side of the body.</items>
                                        </term_definitions>
                                        <term_definitions code="at0031">
                                            <items id="text">Left</items>
                                            <items id="description">The tumour is situated on the left side of the body.</items>
                                        </term_definitions>
                                        <term_definitions code="at0032">
                                            <items id="text">Midline</items>
                                            <items id="description">The tumour is situated midline.</items>
                                        </term_definitions>
                                        <term_definitions code="at0033">
                                            <items id="text">Not known</items>
                                            <items id="description">Tumour laterality is unknown.</items>
                                        </term_definitions>
                                        <term_definitions code="at0034">
                                            <items id="text">Not applicable</items>
                                            <items id="description">Tumour laterality is not applicable.</items>
                                        </term_definitions>
                                        <term_definitions code="at0035">
                                            <items id="text">Basis of diagnosis</items>
                                            <items id="description"></items>
                                        </term_definitions>
                                        <term_definitions code="at0038">
                                            <items id="text">Clonal Plasma Cell %</items>
                                            <items id="description"></items>
                                        </term_definitions>
                                    </children>

                                        <term_definitions code="at0002">
                                            <items id="text">FIGO 1</items>
                                            <items id="description">Predominant glandular growth and < 5% nonsquamous solid component; glandular architecture is identified by the presence of patent lumina within the gland, relatively preserved polarity of the epithelium and absent to mild epithelial stratification.</items>

                                            <items id="description">6-50 percent nonsquamous solid component.</items>
                                        </term_definitions>
                                        <term_definitions code="at0004">
                                            <items id="text">FIGO 3</items>
                                            <items id="description">More than 50 percent nonsquamous solid component.</items>

                                        <term_definitions code="at0003">
                                            <items id="text">Dukes Stage B</items>
                                            <items id="description">Dukes B Tumour penetrates through the muscularis propria to involve extramural tissues, nodes negative.</items>
                                        </term_definitions>

                                            <items id="text">Dukes Stage C1</items>

                                        </term_definitions>
                                        <term_definitions code="at0005">
                                            <items id="text">Dukes Stage C2</items>

                                        </term_definitions>
                                        <term_definitions code="at0006">

                                        <archetype_id>
                                            <value>openEHR-EHR-CLUSTER.tnm.v1</value>
                                        </archetype_id>
                                        <term_definitions code="at0000">
                                            <items id="text">Final TNM</items>
                                            <items id="description">A framework for the clinical classification and stage grouping of malignancies using the TNM system.</items>
                                            <items id="comment">Designated as TNM or cTNM.</items>
                                        </term_definitions>
                                        <term_definitions code="at0001">
                                            <items id="text">Anatomical site</items>
                                            <items id="description">The anatomical site where the assessed tumour is situated.</items>
                                            <items id="comment">Use the value from the TNM variant for each type of cancer. For example: stomach; or small intestine.</items>
                                        </term_definitions>
                                        <term_definitions code="at0002">
                                            <items id="text">Anatomical subsite</items>
                                            <items id="description">The anatomical subsite where the assessed tumour is situated.</items>
                                            <items id="comment">Use the value from the TNM variant for each type of cancer. For example: cardia, fundus, corpus, antrum and pylorus (stomach); or duodenum, jejunum or ileum (small intestine).</items>
                                        </term_definitions>
                                        <term_definitions code="at0003">
                                            <items id="text">Primary tumour (T)</items>
                                            <items id="description">Assessment of the the extent of the primary tumour.</items>
                                            <items id="comment">Coding with a T code appropriate for the tumour type and anatomical site is expected. For example: 'T1'; or 'cT3'. Represented as 'T' or 'cT' in the 'TNM assessment'.</items>
                                        </term_definitions>
                                        <term_definitions code="at0004">
                                            <items id="text">Regional lymph nodes (N)</items>
                                            <items id="description">Assessment of the the absence or presence and extent of regional lymph node metastasis.</items>
                                            <items id="comment">Coding with an N code appropriate for the tumour type and anatomical site is expected. For example: 'NX'; or 'cN2'. Represented as 'N' or 'cN' within the 'TNM assessment'.</items>
                                        </term_definitions>
                                        <term_definitions code="at0005">
                                            <items id="text">Distant metastasis (M)</items>
                                            <items id="description">Assessment of the absence or presence of distant metastasis.</items>
                                            <items id="comment">Coding with an M code appropriate for the tumour type and anatomical site is expected. For example: 'M1'; 'cM1a'; 'M1 PUL'; or 'cM0'. Represented as 'M' or 'cM' within the 'TNM assessment'.</items>
                                        </term_definitions>
                                        <term_definitions code="at0006">
                                            <items id="text">Differentiation</items>
                                            <items id="description">Histopathological grading of the tumour.</items>
                                            <items id="comment">Pretreatment histopathological assessment may be determined from a limited biopsy prior to formal resection. Coding with a G code appropriate for the identified tumour type and anatomical site is expected. For example: 'G2'; 'GX'; or 'low grade' for bone and soft tissue sarcoma classification. Represented as 'G' within the 'TNM assessment'.</items>
                                        </term_definitions>
                                        <term_definitions code="at0007">
                                            <items id="text">Residual tumour (R)</items>
                                            <items id="description">Assessment of the presence of residual tumour after treatment.</items>
                                            <items id="comment">For example: 'R2 (Macroscopic residual tumour)'. Represented as 'R' within the 'TNM assessment'.</items>
                                        </term_definitions>
                                        <term_definitions code="at0008">
                                            <items id="text">RX</items>
                                            <items id="description">Presence of residual tumour cannot be assessed.</items>
                                        </term_definitions>
                                        <term_definitions code="at0009">
                                            <items id="text">R0</items>
                                            <items id="description">No residual tumour.</items>
                                        </term_definitions>
                                        <term_definitions code="at0010">
                                            <items id="text">R1</items>
                                            <items id="description">Microscopic residual tumour.</items>
                                        </term_definitions>
                                        <term_definitions code="at0011">
                                            <items id="text">R2</items>
                                            <items id="description">Macroscopic residual tumour.</items>
                                        </term_definitions>
                                        <term_definitions code="at0012">
                                            <items id="text">Lymphatic invasion (L)</items>
                                            <items id="description">Assessment of invasion into the lymphatic system.</items>
                                            <items id="comment">For example: 'L0 (No lymphatic invasion)'. Represented as 'L' within the 'TNM assessment'.</items>
                                        </term_definitions>
                                        <term_definitions code="at0013">
                                            <items id="text">LX</items>
                                            <items id="description">Lymphatic invasion cannot be assessed.</items>
                                        </term_definitions>
                                        <term_definitions code="at0014">
                                            <items id="text">L0</items>
                                            <items id="description">No lymphatic invasion.</items>
                                        </term_definitions>
                                        <term_definitions code="at0015">
                                            <items id="text">L1</items>
                                            <items id="description">Lymphatic invasion.</items>
                                        </term_definitions>
                                        <term_definitions code="at0016">
                                            <items id="text">Venous invasion (V)</items>
                                            <items id="description">Assessment of invasion into the venous system.</items>
                                            <items id="comment">For example: 'V1 (Microscopic venous invasion)'. Represented as 'V' within the 'TNM assessment'.</items>
                                        </term_definitions>
                                        <term_definitions code="at0017">
                                            <items id="text">VX</items>
                                            <items id="description">Venous invasion cannot be assessed.</items>
                                        </term_definitions>
                                        <term_definitions code="at0018">
                                            <items id="text">V0</items>
                                            <items id="description">No venous invasion.</items>
                                        </term_definitions>
                                        <term_definitions code="at0019">
                                            <items id="text">V1</items>
                                            <items id="description">Microscopic venous invasion.</items>
                                        </term_definitions>
                                        <term_definitions code="at0020">
                                            <items id="text">V2</items>
                                            <items id="description">Macroscopic venous invasion.</items>
                                        </term_definitions>
                                        <term_definitions code="at0021">
                                            <items id="text">Perineural invasion (Pn)</items>
                                            <items id="description">Assessment of invasion into the space surrounding nerves.</items>
                                            <items id="comment">For example: 'Pn0 (No perineural invasion)'. Represented as 'Pn' within the 'TNM assessment'.</items>
                                        </term_definitions>
                                        <term_definitions code="at0022">
                                            <items id="text">PnX</items>
                                            <items id="description">Perineural invasion cannot be assessed.</items>
                                        </term_definitions>
                                        <term_definitions code="at0023">
                                            <items id="text">Pn0</items>
                                            <items id="description">No perineural invasion.</items>
                                        </term_definitions>
                                        <term_definitions code="at0024">
                                            <items id="text">Pn1</items>
                                            <items id="description">Perineural invasion.</items>
                                        </term_definitions>
                                        <term_definitions code="at0025">
                                            <items id="text">Multiple primary tumours (m)</items>
                                            <items id="description">Presence of multiple simultaneous primary tumours at a single site.</items>
                                            <items id="comment">Represented by the suffix, either as '(m)' or the number of primary tumours added to the T code in brackets . For example: 'T2(m)' or 'cT2(4)'.</items>
                                        </term_definitions>
                                        <term_definitions code="at0026">
                                            <items id="text">Multimodality therapy (y)</items>
                                            <items id="description">Record as True if assessment is performed during or following initial multimodal therapy.</items>
                                            <items id="comment">Represented by the prefix 'y' added to the 'TNM assessment'.</items>
                                        </term_definitions>
                                        <term_definitions code="at0027">
                                            <items id="text">Recurrent (r)</items>
                                            <items id="description">Record as True if assessment is performed for a recurring cancer after a disease-free interval.</items>
                                            <items id="comment">Represented by the prefix 'r' added to the 'TNM assessment'.</items>
                                        </term_definitions>
                                        <term_definitions code="at0028">
                                            <items id="text">Autopsy (a)</items>
                                            <items id="description">Record as True if assessment is performed at postmortem examination.</items>
                                            <items id="comment">Represented by the prefix 'a' added to the 'TNM assessment'.</items>
                                        </term_definitions>
                                        <term_definitions code="at0029">
                                            <items id="text">Carcinoma in situ (is)</items>
                                            <items id="description">Record as True if presence of carcinoma in situ associated with the primary tumour.</items>
                                            <items id="comment">Represented by the prefix 'is' added to the 'TNM assessment'.</items>
                                        </term_definitions>
                                        <term_definitions code="at0030">
                                            <items id="text">TNM assessment</items>
                                            <items id="description">Concatenation of 'T', 'N' and 'M' assessments plus any optional assessments of 'G', 'R', 'L', 'V', prefixes and/or suffixes, as applicable.</items>
                                        </term_definitions>
                                        <term_definitions code="at0031">
                                            <items id="text">TNM Stage Group</items>
                                            <items id="description">The categorisation of the anatomical stage of the tumour, usually based on TNM assessment.</items>
                                            <items id="comment">For example: carcinoma in situ is categorised as stage 0; or tumours with distant metastasis are categorised as stage IV.</items>
                                        </term_definitions>
                                        <term_definitions code="at0032">
                                            <items id="text">TNM Version</items>
                                            <items id="description">The edition of the TNM classification system used for the assessment.</items>
                                        </term_definitions>
                                    </children>

                        <archetype_id>
                            <value>openEHR-EHR-EVALUATION.problem_diagnosis.v1</value>
                        </archetype_id>
                        <term_definitions code="at0000">
                            <items id="text">Problem/Diagnosis</items>
                            <items id="description">Details about a single identified health condition, injury, disability or any other issue which impacts on the physical, mental and/or social well-being of an individual.</items>
                            <items id="comment">Clear delineation between the scope of a problem versus a diagnosis is not easy to achieve in practice. For the purposes of clinical documentation with this archetype, problem and diagnosis are regarded as a continuum, with increasing levels of detail and supportive evidence usually providing weight towards the label of 'diagnosis'.</items>
                        </term_definitions>
                        <term_definitions code="at0001">
                            <items id="text">structure</items>
                            <items id="description">@ internal @</items>
                        </term_definitions>
                        <term_definitions code="at0002">
                            <items id="text">Diagnosis</items>
                            <items id="description">Identification of the problem or diagnosis, by name.</items>
                            <items id="comment">Coding of the name of the problem or diagnosis with a terminology is preferred, where possible.</items>
                        </term_definitions>
                        <term_definitions code="at0003">
                            <items id="text">Diagnosis date</items>
                            <items id="description">Estimated or actual date/time the diagnosis or problem was recognised by a healthcare professional.</items>
                            <items id="comment">Partial dates are acceptable. If the subject of care is under the age of one year, then the complete date or a minimum of the month and year is necessary to enable accurate age calculations - for example, if used to drive decision support. Data captured/imported as "Age at time of clinical recognition" should be converted to a date using the subject's date of birth.</items>
                        </term_definitions>
                        <term_definitions code="at0005">
                            <items id="text">Severity</items>
                            <items id="description">An assessment of the overall severity of the problem or diagnosis.</items>
                            <items id="comment">If severity is included in the Problem/diagnosis name via precoordinated codes, this data element becomes redundant. Note: more specific grading of severity can be recorded using the Specific details SLOT.</items>
                        </term_definitions>
                        <term_definitions code="at0009">
                            <items id="text">Description</items>
                            <items id="description">Narrative description about the problem or diagnosis.</items>
                            <items id="comment">Use to provide background and context, including evolution, episodes or exacerbations, progress and any other relevant details, about the problem or diagnosis.</items>
                        </term_definitions>
                        <term_definitions code="at0012">
                            <items id="text">Type</items>
                            <items id="description">Identification of a simple body site for the location of the problem or diagnosis.</items>
                            <items id="comment">Coding of the name of the anatomical location with a terminology is preferred, where possible.
Use this data element to record precoordinated anatomical locations. If the requirements for recording the anatomical location are determined at run-time by the application or require more complex modelling such as relative locations then use the CLUSTER.anatomical_location or CLUSTER.relative_location within the 'Structured anatomical location' SLOT in this archetype. Occurrences for this data element are unbounded to allow for clinical scenarios such as describing a rash in multiple locations but where all of the other attributes are identical. If the anatomical location is included in the Problem/diagnosis name via precoordinated codes, this data element becomes redundant. 

</items>
                        </term_definitions>
                        <term_definitions code="at0030">
                            <items id="text">Date/time of resolution</items>
                            <items id="description">Estimated or actual date/time of resolution or remission for this problem or diagnosis, as determined by a healthcare professional.</items>
                            <items id="comment">Partial dates are acceptable. If the subject of care is under the age of one year, then the complete date or a minimum of the month and year is necessary to enable accurate age calculations - for example, if used to drive decision support. Data captured/imported as "Age at time of resolution" should be converted to a date using the subject's date of birth.
</items>
                        </term_definitions>
                        <term_definitions code="at0032">
                            <items id="text">Tree</items>
                            <items id="description">@ internal @</items>
                        </term_definitions>
                        <term_definitions code="at0039">
                            <items id="text">Structured body site</items>
                            <items id="description">A structured anatomical location for the problem or diagnosis.</items>
                            <items id="comment">Use this SLOT to insert the CLUSTER.anatomical_location or CLUSTER.relative_location archetypes if the requirements for recording the anatomical location are determined at run-time by the application or require more complex modelling such as relative locations.

If the anatomical location is included in the Problem/diagnosis name via precoordinated codes, use of this SLOT becomes redundant.

</items>
                        </term_definitions>
                        <term_definitions code="at0043">
                            <items id="text">Specific details</items>
                            <items id="description">Details that are additionally required to record as unique attributes of this problem or diagnosis.</items>
                            <items id="comment">May include structured detail about the grading or staging of the diagnosis; diagnostic criteria, classification criteria or formal severity assessments such as Common Terminology Criteria for Adverse Events.</items>
                        </term_definitions>
                        <term_definitions code="at0046">
                            <items id="text">Status</items>
                            <items id="description">Structured details for location-, domain-, episode- or workflow-specific aspects of the diagnostic process.</items>
                            <items id="comment">Use status or context qualifiers with care, as they are variably used in practice and interoperability cannot be assured unless usage is clearly defined with the community of use. For example: active status - active, inactive, resolved, in remission; evolution status - initial, interim/working, final; temporal status - current, past; episodicity status - first, new, ongoing; admission status - admission, discharge; or priority status - primary, secondary.</items>
                        </term_definitions>
                        <term_definitions code="at0047">
                            <items id="text">Mild</items>
                            <items id="description">The problem or diagnosis does not interfere with normal activity or may cause damage to health if left untreated.</items>
                        </term_definitions>
                        <term_definitions code="at0048">
                            <items id="text">Moderate</items>
                            <items id="description">The problem or diagnosis causes interference with normal activity or will damage health if left untreated.</items>
                        </term_definitions>
                        <term_definitions code="at0049">
                            <items id="text">Severe</items>
                            <items id="description">The problem or diagnosis prevents normal activity or will seriously damage health if left untreated.</items>
                        </term_definitions>
                        <term_definitions code="at0069">
                            <items id="text">Comment</items>
                            <items id="description">Additional narrative about the problem or diagnosis not captured in other fields.</items>
                        </term_definitions>
                        <term_definitions code="at0070">
                            <items id="text">Last updated</items>
                            <items id="description">The date this problem or diagnosis was last updated.</items>
                        </term_definitions>
                        <term_definitions code="at0071">
                            <items id="text">Extension</items>
                            <items id="description">Additional information required to capture local content or to align with other reference models/formalisms.</items>
                            <items id="comment">For example: local information requirements or additional metadata to align with FHIR or CIMI equivalents.</items>
                        </term_definitions>
                        <term_definitions code="at0072">
                            <items id="text">Course description</items>
                            <items id="description">Narrative description about the course of the problem or diagnosis since onset.</items>
                        </term_definitions>
                        <term_definitions code="at0073">
                            <items id="text">Diagnostic certainty</items>
                            <items id="description">The level of confidence in the identification of the diagnosis.</items>
                        </term_definitions>
                        <term_definitions code="at0074">
                            <items id="text">Suspected</items>
                            <items id="description">The diagnosis has been identified with a low level of certainty.</items>
                        </term_definitions>
                        <term_definitions code="at0075">
                            <items id="text">Probable</items>
                            <items id="description">The diagnosis has been identified with a high level of certainty.</items>
                        </term_definitions>
                        <term_definitions code="at0076">
                            <items id="text">Confirmed</items>
                            <items id="description">The diagnosis has been confirmed against recognised criteria.</items>
                        </term_definitions>
                        <term_definitions code="at0077">
                            <items id="text">First seen date</items>
                            <items id="description">Estimated or actual date/time that signs or symptoms of the problem/diagnosis were first observed.</items>
                            <items id="comment">Data captured/imported as "Age at onset" should be converted to a date using the subject's date of birth.</items>
                        </term_definitions>
                    </children>

                        <term_definitions code="at0000">
                            <items id="text">Child-Pugh Score</items>
                            <items id="description">Child-Pugh score used for chronic liver disease/cirrhosis prognosis.</items>
                        </term_definitions>
                        <term_definitions code="at0001">
                            <items id="text">History</items>
                            <items id="description">*</items>
                        </term_definitions>
                        <term_definitions code="at0002">
                            <items id="text">Any Event</items>
                            <items id="description">*</items>
                        </term_definitions>
                        <term_definitions code="at0003">
                            <items id="text">ItemTree</items>
                            <items id="description">@ internal @</items>
                        </term_definitions>
                        <term_definitions code="at0004">
                            <items id="text">Total bilirubin</items>
                            <items id="description">Score for total bilirubin in micromole/litre.</items>
                        </term_definitions>
                        <term_definitions code="at0005">
                            <items id="text">Less than 34</items>
                            <items id="description">Total bilirubin is less than 34.</items>
                        </term_definitions>
                        <term_definitions code="at0006">
                            <items id="text">34 to 50</items>
                            <items id="description">Total bilirubin is between 34 and 50.</items>
                        </term_definitions>
                        <term_definitions code="at0007">
                            <items id="text">Greater than 50</items>
                            <items id="description">Total bilirubin is more than 50.</items>
                        </term_definitions>
                        <term_definitions code="at0008">
                            <items id="text">Serum albumin</items>
                            <items id="description">Score for serum albumin in grams per litre.</items>
                        </term_definitions>
                        <term_definitions code="at0009">
                            <items id="text">Greater than 35</items>
                            <items id="description">Serum albumin is greater than 35.</items>
                        </term_definitions>
                        <term_definitions code="at0010">
                            <items id="text">28 to 35</items>
                            <items id="description">Serum albumin is between 28 and 35.</items>
                        </term_definitions>
                        <term_definitions code="at0011">
                            <items id="text">Less than 28</items>
                            <items id="description">Serum albumin is less than 28.</items>
                        </term_definitions>
                        <term_definitions code="at0012">
                            <items id="text">INR</items>
                            <items id="description">Score for INR.</items>
                        </term_definitions>
                        <term_definitions code="at0013">
                            <items id="text">Less than 1.7</items>
                            <items id="description">INR is less than 1.7.</items>
                        </term_definitions>
                        <term_definitions code="at0014">
                            <items id="text">1.7 to 2.3</items>
                            <items id="description">INR is between 1.7 and 2.3.</items>
                        </term_definitions>
                        <term_definitions code="at0015">
                            <items id="text">Greater than 2.3</items>
                            <items id="description">INR is greater than 2.3.</items>
                        </term_definitions>
                        <term_definitions code="at0016">
                            <items id="text">Ascites</items>
                            <items id="description">Score for presence of ascites.</items>
                        </term_definitions>
                        <term_definitions code="at0017">
                            <items id="text">None</items>
                            <items id="description">No ascites is present.</items>
                        </term_definitions>
                        <term_definitions code="at0018">
                            <items id="text">Mild</items>
                            <items id="description">Mild ascites is present.</items>
                        </term_definitions>
                        <term_definitions code="at0019">
                            <items id="text">Moderate to severe</items>
                            <items id="description">Moderate to severe ascites is present.</items>
                        </term_definitions>
                        <term_definitions code="at0020">
                            <items id="text">Hepatic encephalopathy</items>
                            <items id="description">Score for presence of hepatic encephalopathy.</items>
                        </term_definitions>
                        <term_definitions code="at0021">
                            <items id="text">None</items>
                            <items id="description">No hepatic encephalopathy is present.</items>
                        </term_definitions>
                        <term_definitions code="at0022">
                            <items id="text">Grade I to II or suppressed with medication</items>
                            <items id="description">Grade I or Grade II hepatic encephalopathy is present or hepatic encephalopathy is suppressed with medication.</items>
                        </term_definitions>
                        <term_definitions code="at0023">
                            <items id="text">Grade III to IV or refractory</items>
                            <items id="description">Grade III or Grade IV hepatic encephalopathy is present or hepatic encephalopathy is refractory.</items>
                        </term_definitions>
                        <term_definitions code="at0024">
                            <items id="text">Adjusted bilirubin</items>
                            <items id="description">Score for total bilirubin if the patient has primary biliary cirrhosis or sclerosing cholangitis.</items>
                        </term_definitions>
                        <term_definitions code="at0025">
                            <items id="text">Less than 68</items>
                            <items id="description">Total bilirubin is less than 68.</items>
                        </term_definitions>
                        <term_definitions code="at0026">
                            <items id="text">68 to 170</items>
                            <items id="description">Total bilirubin is between 68 and 170.</items>
                        </term_definitions>
                        <term_definitions code="at0027">
                            <items id="text">Greater than 170</items>
                            <items id="description">Total bilirubin is greater than 170.</items>
                        </term_definitions>
                        <term_definitions code="at0028">
                            <items id="text">Total Child-Pugh score</items>
                            <items id="description">Total Child-Pugh score.</items>
                        </term_definitions>
                        <term_definitions code="at0029">
                            <items id="text">Grade</items>
                            <items id="description">Grading according to total score.</items>
                        </term_definitions>
                        <term_definitions code="at0030">
                            <items id="text">Class A 5 to 6 points</items>
                            <items id="description">The Child-Pugh grade is Class A with a total score of 5 to 6 points.</items>
                        </term_definitions>
                        <term_definitions code="at0031">
                            <items id="text">Class B 7 to 9 points</items>
                            <items id="description">The Child-Pugh grade is Class B with a total score of 7 to 9 points.</items>
                        </term_definitions>
                        <term_definitions code="at0032">
                            <items id="text">Class C 10 to 15 points</items>
                            <items id="description">The Child-Pugh grade is Class C with a total score of 10 to 15 points.</items>
                        </term_definitions>
                        <term_definitions code="at0033">
                            <items id="text">ItemTree</items>
                            <items id="description">@ internal @</items>
                        </term_definitions>
                        <term_definitions code="at0034">

                            <items id="description">Narrative description of any issues or factors that may impact on the calculation.</items>
                        </term_definitions>

                            <items id="comment">Local information requirements or additional metadata to align with FHIR or CIMI equivalents.</items>
                        </term_definitions>

                        <term_definitions code="at0000">
                            <items id="text">Height</items>
                            <items id="description">Height, or body length, is measured from crown of head to sole of foot.</items>
                            <items id="comment">Height is measured with the individual in a standing position and body length in a recumbent position.</items>
                        </term_definitions>
                        <term_definitions code="at0001">
                            <items id="text">history</items>
                            <items id="description">@ internal @</items>
                        </term_definitions>
                        <term_definitions code="at0002">
                            <items id="text">Any event</items>
                            <items id="description">Default, unspecified point in time or interval event which may be explicitly defined in a template or at run-time.</items>
                        </term_definitions>
                        <term_definitions code="at0003">
                            <items id="text">Simple</items>
                            <items id="description">@ internal @</items>
                        </term_definitions>
                        <term_definitions code="at0004">
                            <items id="text">Height/Length</items>
                            <items id="description">The length of the body from crown of head to sole of foot.</items>
                        </term_definitions>
                        <term_definitions code="at0007">
                            <items id="text">List</items>
                            <items id="description">@ internal @</items>
                        </term_definitions>
                        <term_definitions code="at0011">
                            <items id="text">Device</items>
                            <items id="description">Description of the device used to measure height or body length.</items>
                        </term_definitions>
                        <term_definitions code="at0013">
                            <items id="text">Tree</items>
                            <items id="description">@ internal @</items>
                        </term_definitions>
                        <term_definitions code="at0014">
                            <items id="text">Position</items>
                            <items id="description">Position of individual when measured.</items>
                        </term_definitions>
                        <term_definitions code="at0016">
                            <items id="text">Standing</items>
                            <items id="description">Height is measured standing on both feet with weight distributed evenly, heels together and both buttocks and heels in contact with a vertical back board.</items>
                        </term_definitions>
                        <term_definitions code="at0018">
                            <items id="text">Comment</items>
                            <items id="description">Additional narrative about the measurement, not captured in other fields.</items>
                        </term_definitions>
                        <term_definitions code="at0019">
                            <items id="text">Confounding factors</items>
                            <items id="description">Narrative description of any issues or factors that may impact on the measurement.</items>
                            <items id="comment">For example: noting of amputation.</items>
                        </term_definitions>
                        <term_definitions code="at0020">
                            <items id="text">Lying</items>
                            <items id="description">Length is measured in a fully extended, recumbent position with the pelvis flat, legs extended and feet flexed.</items>
                        </term_definitions>
                        <term_definitions code="at0021">
                            <items id="text">Birth</items>
                            <items id="description">Usually the first length measurement, recorded soon after birth. This event will only be used once per health record
.</items>
                        </term_definitions>
                        <term_definitions code="at0022">
                            <items id="text">Extension</items>
                            <items id="description">Additional information required to capture local content or to align with other reference models/formalisms.</items>
                            <items id="comment">For example: local information requirements or additional metadata to align with FHIR or CIMI equivalents.</items>
                        </term_definitions>

                                    </terminology_id>
                                    <code_string>[LOINC::8302-2]</code_string>
                                </value>
                            </items>
                        </term_bindings>

                            <items id="text">Any event</items>
                            <items id="description">Default, unspecified point in time or interval event which may be explicitly defined in a template or at run-time.</items>
                        </term_definitions>
                        <term_definitions code="at0004">
                            <items id="text">Weight</items>
                            <items id="description">The weight of the individual.</items>
                        </term_definitions>
                        <term_definitions code="at0008">
                            <items id="text">state structure</items>
                            <items id="description">@ internal @</items>
                        </term_definitions>
                        <term_definitions code="at0009">
                            <items id="text">State of dress</items>
                            <items id="description">Description of the state of dress of the person at the time of weighing.</items>
                        </term_definitions>
                        <term_definitions code="at0010">
                            <items id="text">Fully clothed, including shoes</items>
                            <items id="description">Clothing which may add significantly to weight, including shoes.</items>
                        </term_definitions>
                        <term_definitions code="at0011">
                            <items id="text">Lightly clothed/underwear</items>
                            <items id="description">Clothing which will not add to weight significantly.</items>
                        </term_definitions>
                        <term_definitions code="at0013">
                            <items id="text">Naked</items>
                            <items id="description">Without any clothes.</items>
                        </term_definitions>
                        <term_definitions code="at0015">
                            <items id="text">protocol structure</items>
                            <items id="description">@ internal @</items>
                        </term_definitions>
                        <term_definitions code="at0017">
                            <items id="text">Nappy/diaper</items>
                            <items id="description">Wearing only a nappy - which may add significantly to weight.</items>
                        </term_definitions>
                        <term_definitions code="at0020">
                            <items id="text">Device</items>
                            <items id="description">Details about the weighing device.</items>
                        </term_definitions>
                        <term_definitions code="at0024">
                            <items id="text">Comment</items>
                            <items id="description">Additional narrative about the measurement of Body weight, not captured in other fields.</items>
                        </term_definitions>
                        <term_definitions code="at0025">
                            <items id="text">Confounding factors</items>
                            <items id="description">Record any issues or factors that may impact on the measurement of body weight eg timing in menstrual cycle, timing of recent bowel motion or noting of amputation.</items>
                        </term_definitions>
                        <term_definitions code="at0026">
                            <items id="text">Birth</items>
                            <items id="description">Usually the first weight, measured soon after birth. This event will only be used once per health record
.</items>
                        </term_definitions>
                        <term_definitions code="at0027">
                            <items id="text">Extension</items>
                            <items id="description">Additional information required to capture local content or to align with other reference models/formalisms.</items>
                            <items id="comment">For example: local information requirements or additional metadata to align with FHIR or CIMI equivalents.</items>
                        </term_definitions>
                        <term_definitions code="at0028">
                            <items id="text">Fully clothed, without shoes</items>
                            <items id="description">Clothing which may add significantly to weight.</items>
                        </term_definitions>

                                    </terminology_id>

                                </value>
                            </items>
                        </term_bindings>

                        <archetype_id>
                            <value>openEHR-EHR-EVALUATION.menstrual_cycle_summary.v0</value>
                        </archetype_id>
                        <term_definitions code="at0000">
                            <items id="text">Menstruation summary</items>
                            <items id="description">Summary or persistent information about an individual's menstruation history.</items>
                        </term_definitions>
                        <term_definitions code="at0001">
                            <items id="text">Tree</items>
                            <items id="description">@ internal @</items>
                        </term_definitions>
                        <term_definitions code="at0002">
                            <items id="text">Age at menarche</items>
                            <items id="description">Age at onset of first menstrual cycle.</items>
                        </term_definitions>
                        <term_definitions code="at0003">
                            <items id="text">Menstrual status</items>
                            <items id="description">Statement about the current menstrual activity.</items>
                            <items id="comment">If this data element is updated, the 'Date last updated' in Protocol should also be amended.</items>
                        </term_definitions>
                        <term_definitions code="at0004">
                            <items id="text">Age at menopause</items>
                            <items id="description">Age at cessation of menstrual cycles.</items>
                        </term_definitions>
                        <term_definitions code="at0005">
                            <items id="text">Premenopausal</items>
                            <items id="description">After menarche, preceding menopause and without symptoms related to the hormonal changes preceding menopause.</items>
                        </term_definitions>
                        <term_definitions code="at0006">
                            <items id="text">Perimenopausal</items>
                            <items id="description">Preceding menopause with symptoms related to the hormonal changes leading up to menopause.</items>
                        </term_definitions>
                        <term_definitions code="at0007">
                            <items id="text">Postmenopausal</items>
                            <items id="description">After menopause.</items>
                        </term_definitions>
                        <term_definitions code="at0008">
                            <items id="text">Item tree</items>
                            <items id="description">@ internal @</items>
                        </term_definitions>
                        <term_definitions code="at0009">
                            <items id="text">Extension</items>
                            <items id="description">Additional information required to capture local content or to align with other reference models/formalisms.</items>
                            <items id="comment">For example: local information requirements or additional metadata to align with FHIR or CIMI equivalents.</items>
                        </term_definitions>
                        <term_definitions code="at0010">
                            <items id="text">Per episode</items>
                            <items id="description">Details about a typical pattern of menstruation during a specified interval of time.</items>
                            <items id="comment">If the pattern of menstruation changes significantly, or other factors significantly interrupt (for example, a full term pregnancy) or influence (for example, changing contraception methods) the menstrual cycle, then it may be useful to record as a new episode .</items>
                        </term_definitions>
                        <term_definitions code="at0011">
                            <items id="text">Episode label</items>
                            <items id="description">A name or label associated with this episode of menstruation.</items>
                            <items id="comment">The label will allow a specific episode to be distinguished from other episodes with similar or different menstruation patterns. For example: 'Post Pregnancy #2'; 'Commenced POP'.</items>
                        </term_definitions>
                        <term_definitions code="at0012">
                            <items id="text">Episode start date</items>
                            <items id="description">Date when this episode commenced.</items>
                            <items id="comment">Can be a partial date, for example, only a year.</items>
                        </term_definitions>
                        <term_definitions code="at0013">
                            <items id="text">Description</items>
                            <items id="description">Narrative description about this episode.</items>
                        </term_definitions>
                        <term_definitions code="at0014">
                            <items id="text">Typical pattern</items>
                            <items id="description">The usual predictability of menstruation during this episode.</items>
                        </term_definitions>
                        <term_definitions code="at0015">
                            <items id="text">Regular</items>
                            <items id="description">The start of menses is roughly predictable from month to month.</items>
                        </term_definitions>
                        <term_definitions code="at0016">
                            <items id="text">Irregular</items>
                            <items id="description">The start of menses is not predictable month to month.</items>
                        </term_definitions>
                        <term_definitions code="at0017">
                            <items id="text">Typical cycle length</items>
                            <items id="description">The usual length of cycle during this episode.</items>
                        </term_definitions>
                        <term_definitions code="at0018">
                            <items id="text">Typical menses duration</items>
                            <items id="description">The usual duration of menses during this episode.</items>
                        </term_definitions>
                        <term_definitions code="at0020">
                            <items id="text">Additional details</items>
                            <items id="description">Additional structured details about this episode of menstruation.</items>
                        </term_definitions>
                        <term_definitions code="at0021">
                            <items id="text">Episode end date</items>
                            <items id="description">Date when this episode ceased.</items>
                            <items id="comment">Can be a partial date, for example, only a year. This data field will be empty if the episode is current and ongoing.</items>
                        </term_definitions>
                        <term_definitions code="at0022">
                            <items id="text">Episode comment</items>
                            <items id="description">Additional narrative about this episode of menstruation not captured in other fields.</items>
                        </term_definitions>
                        <term_definitions code="at0023">
                            <items id="text">Comment</items>
                            <items id="description">Additional narrative about the overall patterns and episodes of menstruation not captured in other fields.</items>
                        </term_definitions>
                        <term_definitions code="at0024">
                            <items id="text">Date last updated</items>
                            <items id="description">Date when the Menstruation summary, including episodes, was updated.</items>
                        </term_definitions>
                        <term_definitions code="at0025">
                            <items id="text">Overall description</items>
                            <items id="description">Narrative description about the overall pattern of menstruation.</items>
                        </term_definitions>
                        <term_definitions code="at0026">
                            <items id="text">Premenarchal</items>
                            <items id="description">Before the first onset of menstruation.</items>
                        </term_definitions>
                    </children>
