                        <term_definitions code="at0000">
                            <items id="text">Gynaecological cancer risk</items>
                            <items id="description">Assessment of the potential and likelihood of future adverse health effects as determined by identified risk factors.</items>
                        </term_definitions>
                        <term_definitions code="at0001">
                            <items id="text">structure</items>
                            <items id="description">@ internal @</items>
                        </term_definitions>
                        <term_definitions code="at0002">
                            <items id="text">Health risk</items>
                            <items id="description">Identification of the potential future disease, condition or health issue for which the risk is being assessed, by name.</items>
                            <items id="comment">Coding of 'Health risk' with a terminology is preferred, where possible. Free text should be used only if there is no appropriate terminology available. For example: risk of cardiovascular disease, with risk factors of hypertension and hypercholesterolaemia.</items>
                        </term_definitions>
                        <term_definitions code="at0003">
                            <items id="text">Risk assessment</items>
                            <items id="description">Evaluation of the health risk.</items>
                            <items id="comment">There may be multiple variations on the assessment of risk. The Choice data type allows for recording of the assessment as either free text or value sets (such as low, medium or hig). The proportion data type allows recording of a percentage, a ratio or a fraction. The quantity data type allows recording of a decimal number.</items>
                        </term_definitions>
                        <term_definitions code="at0004">
                            <items id="text">Rationale</items>
                            <items id="description">Justification for this risk assessment.</items>
                            <items id="comment">Details that may be added to this data element may include information about the population subgroups etc against which the determination of risk is assessed.</items>
                        </term_definitions>
                        <term_definitions code="at0010">
                            <items id="text">Tree</items>
                            <items id="description">@ internal @</items>
                        </term_definitions>
                        <term_definitions code="at0011">
                            <items id="text">Extension</items>
                            <items id="description">Additional information required to capture local content or to align with other reference models/formalisms.</items>
                            <items id="comment">For example:  local information requirements or additional metadata to align with FHIR or CIMI equivalents.</items>
                        </term_definitions>
                        <term_definitions code="at0012">
                            <items id="text">Link to evidence</items>
                            <items id="description">Identification of the path to the archetype or data node for the evidence of risk.</items>
                        </term_definitions>
                        <term_definitions code="at0013">
                            <items id="text">Risk factor</items>
                            <items id="description">Identification of the risk factor, by name.</items>
                            <items id="comment">For example: hypertension and hypercholesterolaemia, which may be used as part of the overall assessment for cardiovascular disease; or a genetic marker. Coding of 
'Risk factor' with a terminology, where possible.</items>
                        </term_definitions>
                        <term_definitions code="at0014">
                            <items id="text">Description</items>
                            <items id="description">Narrative description about the risk factor.</items>
                        </term_definitions>
                        <term_definitions code="at0015">
                            <items id="text">Comment</items>
                            <items id="description">Additional narrative about the risk assessment not captured in other fields.</items>
                        </term_definitions>
                        <term_definitions code="at0016">
                            <items id="text">Coil</items>
                            <items id="description">Details about each possible risk factor.</items>
                        </term_definitions>
                        <term_definitions code="at0017">
                            <items id="text">Presence</items>
                            <items id="description">Presence of the risk factor.</items>
                        </term_definitions>
                        <term_definitions code="at0018">
                            <items id="text">Present</items>
                            <items id="description">The risk factor has been identified for this individual.</items>
                        </term_definitions>
                        <term_definitions code="at0019">
                            <items id="text">Absent</items>
                            <items id="description">The risk factor has not been identified for this individual.</items>
                        </term_definitions>
                        <term_definitions code="at0020">
                            <items id="text">Assessment type</items>
                            <items id="description">Record of whether the risk assessment is a relative or absolute.</items>
                        </term_definitions>
                        <term_definitions code="at0021">
                            <items id="text">Relative risk</items>
                            <items id="description">Ratio of probability of a health event or condition occurring compared to a population with similar characteristics eg same age and sex.</items>
                        </term_definitions>
                        <term_definitions code="at0022">
                            <items id="text">Absolute risk</items>
                            <items id="description">Ratio of probability of a health event or condition occurring compared to the population as a whole.</items>
                        </term_definitions>
                        <term_definitions code="at0023">
                            <items id="text">Total time</items>
                            <items id="description">The time period during which the predicted health risk is relevant.</items>
                            <items id="comment">That is: the risk of experiencing the identified 'Health risk' in the next <X> years.</items>
                        </term_definitions>
                        <term_definitions code="at0024">
                            <items id="text">Last updated</items>
                            <items id="description">The date this health risk assessment was last updated.</items>
                            <items id="comment">This data element may be thought redundant if the data is recorded and stored using COMPOSITIONs within a closed clinical system. However if this information is extracted from its original COMPOSITION context, for example, to be included in another document or message then the temporal context is effectively removed. This 'Last updated' data element has been explicitly added to allow the critical temporal data to be kept alongside the clinical data in all circumstances. It is assumed that the clinical system can copy the date from the COMPOSITION to reduce the need for duplication of data entry by the clinician.</items>
                        </term_definitions>
                        <term_definitions code="at0025">
                            <items id="text">Assessment method</items>
                            <items id="description">Identification of the algorithm or guideline used to make the assessment of risk.</items>
                            <items id="comment">For example: Framingham cardiovascular risk calculator.</items>
                        </term_definitions>
                        <term_definitions code="at0026">
                            <items id="text">Indeterminate</items>
                            <items id="description">It is not possible to determine if the risk factor is present or absent.</items>
                        </term_definitions>
                        <term_definitions code="at0027">
                            <items id="text">Detail</items>
                            <items id="description">Structured detail about other aspects of the risk factor assessment.</items>
                            <items id="comment">For example: Prevalence of the risk factor in family members.</items>
                        </term_definitions>
                        <term_definitions code="at0028">
                            <items id="text">Mitigated</items>
                            <items id="description">The risk factor has been identified as present, but then subsequently been mitigated by treatment or investigation.</items>
                            <items id="comment">Record as True if the risk factor has been treated or investigated and risk from this risk factor is considered to be lessened. For example: an infant given gentamicin in neonatal intensive care is regarded as having a risk of permanent hearing loss. If diagnostic testing shows no evidence of hearing loss in the first year of life, the risk of later hearing loss is considered to be much reduced, but still possible. This data element allows clinicians to say that the risk has been mitigated but should still be considered as a possibility in future. In practice, the risk factor could be maintained in the risk assessment in case it might impact the individual's health at a future time, but flagging that its contribution to risk calculation may not be as great as if it had not been previously treated or investigated. </items>
                        </term_definitions>
                        <term_definitions code="at0029">
                            <items id="text">Date identified</items>
                            <items id="description">The date/time that the risk factor was identified.</items>
                        </term_definitions>
                        <term_definitions code="at0030">
                            <items id="text">Comment</items>
                            <items id="description">Additional narrative about the risk factor not captured in other fields.</items>
                        </term_definitions>

                                </value>
                            </items>
                        </term_bindings>

                        <term_definitions code="at0000">
                            <items id="text">Death details</items>
                            <items id="description">Local archetype to capture death details in Genomics England cancer and rare diseases datasets.</items>
                        </term_definitions>
                        <term_definitions code="at0001">
                            <items id="text">Tree</items>
                            <items id="description">@ internal @</items>
                        </term_definitions>
                        <term_definitions code="at0002">
                            <items id="text">Death location</items>
                            <items id="description">The location where death occurred.</items>
                        </term_definitions>
                        <term_definitions code="at0003">
                            <items id="text">1: Hospital</items>
                            <items id="description">The participant died in hospital.</items>
                        </term_definitions>
                        <term_definitions code="at0004">
                            <items id="text">2: NHS hospice or specialist palliative care unit</items>
                            <items id="description">The participant died in an NHS hospice or NHS specialist palliative care unit.</items>
                        </term_definitions>
                        <term_definitions code="at0005">
                            <items id="text">3: Voluntary hospice or specialist palliative care unit</items>
                            <items id="description">The participant died in a voluntary hospice or voluntary specialist palliative care unit.</items>
                        </term_definitions>
                        <term_definitions code="at0006">
                            <items id="text">4: Patient's own home</items>
                            <items id="description">The participant died in their own home.</items>
                        </term_definitions>
                        <term_definitions code="at0007">
                            <items id="text">5: Care home</items>
                            <items id="description">The participant died in a care home.</items>
                        </term_definitions>
                        <term_definitions code="at0008">
                            <items id="text">6: Other</items>
                            <items id="description">The participant died in a location not specified by the other options.</items>
                        </term_definitions>
                        <term_definitions code="at0009">
                            <items id="text">Significant condition not leading to death</items>
                            <items id="description">Significant condition not leading to death. Coded according to the International Classification of Diseases (ICD) code of the condition leading to death as recorded on the death certificate.</items>
                        </term_definitions>
                        <term_definitions code="at0010">
                            <items id="text">Death cause</items>
                            <items id="description">Immediate cause of death. Coded according to the International Classification of Diseases (ICD) code of the condition leading to death as recorded on the death certificate.</items>
                        </term_definitions>
                        <term_definitions code="at0011">
                            <items id="text">Significant condition leading to death</items>
                            <items id="description">Condition leading to death. Coded according to the International Classification of Diseases (ICD) code of the condition leading to death as recorded on the death certificate.</items>
                        </term_definitions>
                        <term_definitions code="at0012">
                            <items id="text">Underlying cause</items>
                            <items id="description">Underlying cause of death. Coded according to the International Classification of Diseases (ICD) code of the condition leading to death as recorded on the death certificate.</items>
                        </term_definitions>
                        <term_definitions code="at0013">
                            <items id="text">Related diagnosis</items>
                            <items id="description">Any other relevant diagnosis. Coded according to the International Classification of Diseases (ICD) code of the condition leading to death as recorded on the death certificate.</items>
                        </term_definitions>
                        <term_definitions code="at0014">
                            <items id="text">Tree</items>
                            <items id="description">@ internal @</items>
                        </term_definitions>
                        <term_definitions code="at0015">
                            <items id="text">Extension</items>
                            <items id="description">Additional information required to capture local context or to align with other reference models/formalisms.</items>
                            <items id="comment">e.g. Local hospital departmental infomation or additional metadata to align with HL7 or CDISC equivalents.</items>
                        </term_definitions>
                        <term_definitions code="at0016">
                            <items id="text">Date of death</items>
                            <items id="description">The date of death of the patient.</items>
                        </term_definitions>
                    </children>

                                                                        <archetype_id>
                                                                            <value>openEHR-EHR-CLUSTER.laboratory_test_analyte.v1</value>
                                                                        </archetype_id>
                                                                        <term_definitions code="ml/min/1.73m²">
                                                                            <items id="text">EstimatedGlomerularFiltrationRate</items>
                                                                            <items id="description">ml/min/1.73m²</items>
                                                                        </term_definitions>
                                                                        <term_definitions code="at0000">
                                                                            <items id="text">Laboratory analyte result</items>
                                                                            <items id="description">The result of a laboratory test for a single analyte value.</items>
                                                                        </term_definitions>
                                                                        <term_definitions code="at0001">
                                                                            <items id="text">Analyte result</items>
                                                                            <items id="description">The value of the analyte result.</items>
                                                                            <items id="comment">For example '7.3 mmol/l', 'Raised'. The 'Any' data type will need to be constrained to an appropriate data type in a specialisation, a template or at run-time to reflect the actual analyte result. The Quantity data type has reference model attributes that include flags for normal/abnormal, reference ranges and approximations - see https://specifications.openehr.org/releases/RM/latest/data_types.html#_dv_quantity_class for more details.</items>
                                                                        </term_definitions>
                                                                        <term_definitions code="at0003">
                                                                            <items id="text">Comment</items>
                                                                            <items id="description">Additional narrative about the analyte result, not captured in other fields.</items>
                                                                        </term_definitions>
                                                                        <term_definitions code="at0004">
                                                                            <items id="text">Reference range guidance</items>
                                                                            <items id="description">Additional advice on the applicability of the reference range to this result or may carry text or coded textual guidance as to whether the result is within the normal range.</items>
                                                                            <items id="comment">For example, 'within normal limits for age and sex'.</items>
                                                                        </term_definitions>
                                                                        <term_definitions code="at0005">
                                                                            <items id="text">Result status</items>
                                                                            <items id="description">The status of the analyte result value.</items>
                                                                            <items id="comment">The values have been specifically chosen to match those in the HL7 FHIR Diagnostic report, historically derived from HL7v2 practice. Other local codes/terms can be used via the Text 'choice'.</items>
                                                                        </term_definitions>
                                                                        <term_definitions code="at0006">
                                                                            <items id="text">Result status time</items>
                                                                            <items id="description">The date and time that the analyte result was issued for the recorded ‘Result status’.</items>
                                                                        </term_definitions>
                                                                        <term_definitions code="at0014">
                                                                            <items id="text">Analyte result detail</items>
                                                                            <items id="description">Further detail regarding an individual result.</items>
                                                                        </term_definitions>
                                                                        <term_definitions code="at0015">
                                                                            <items id="text">Registered</items>
                                                                            <items id="description">The existence of the test is registered in the Laboratory Information System, but there is nothing yet available.</items>
                                                                        </term_definitions>
                                                                        <term_definitions code="at0016">
                                                                            <items id="text">Partial</items>
                                                                            <items id="description">This is a partial (e.g. initial, interim or preliminary) Test Result: data in the Test Result may be incomplete or unverified.</items>
                                                                        </term_definitions>
                                                                        <term_definitions code="at0017">
                                                                            <items id="text">Preliminary</items>
                                                                            <items id="description">Verified early results are available, but not all results are final. This is a sub-category of 'Partial'.</items>
                                                                        </term_definitions>
                                                                        <term_definitions code="at0018">
                                                                            <items id="text">Final</items>
                                                                            <items id="description">The Test result is complete and verified by an authorised person.</items>
                                                                        </term_definitions>
                                                                        <term_definitions code="at0019">
                                                                            <items id="text">Corrected</items>
                                                                            <items id="description">The result has been modified subsequent to being Final, and is complete and verified by the responsible pathologist. This is a sub-category of 'Amended'.</items>
                                                                        </term_definitions>
                                                                        <term_definitions code="at0020">
                                                                            <items id="text">Amended</items>
                                                                            <items id="description">The result has been modified subsequent to being Final, and is complete and verified by the responsible pathologist, and result data has been changed.</items>
                                                                        </term_definitions>
                                                                        <term_definitions code="at0021">
                                                                            <items id="text">Appended</items>
                                                                            <items id="description">Subsequent to being final, the report has been modified by adding new content. The existing content is unchanged. This is a sub-category of 'Amended'.</items>
                                                                        </term_definitions>
                                                                        <term_definitions code="at0022">
                                                                            <items id="text">Entered in error</items>
                                                                            <items id="description">The Test Result has been withdrawn following previous Final release.</items>
                                                                        </term_definitions>
                                                                        <term_definitions code="at0023">
                                                                            <items id="text">Cancelled</items>
                                                                            <items id="description">The result is unavailable because the test was not started or not completed (also sometimes called 'aborted').</items>
                                                                        </term_definitions>
                                                                        <term_definitions code="at0024">
                                                                            <items id="text">Analyte name</items>
                                                                            <items id="description">The name of the analyte result.</items>
                                                                            <items id="comment">The value for this element is normally supplied in a specialisation, in a template or at run-time to reflect the actual analyte. For example: 'Serum sodium', 'Haemoglobin'. Coding with an external terminology is strongly recommended, such as LOINC, NPU, SNOMED CT, or local lab terminologies.</items>
                                                                        </term_definitions>
                                                                        <term_definitions code="at0025">
                                                                            <items id="text">Validation time</items>
                                                                            <items id="description">The date and time that the analyte result was validated in the laboratory by a healthcare practitioner.</items>
                                                                            <items id="comment">In many jurisdictions the 'Result status' is assumed to include medical validation i.e. a 'final' result will be assumed to be medically validated, but in others this will be recorded and reported separately using this data element.</items>
                                                                        </term_definitions>
                                                                        <term_definitions code="at0026">
                                                                            <items id="text">Specimen</items>
                                                                            <items id="description">Identification of the specimen used for the analyte result.</items>
                                                                            <items id="comment">In some situations, a single Laboratory test result archetype will contain multiple Specimen archetypes and multiple Analyte result archetypes. In these situations, this 'Specimen' data element is needed to be able to connect the results with the correct specimens.</items>
                                                                        </term_definitions>
                                                                        <term_definitions code="at0027">
                                                                            <items id="text">Analyte result sequence</items>
                                                                            <items id="description">The intended position of this analyte result within the overall sequence of analyte results.</items>
                                                                            <items id="comment">For example: ''1' '2', '3'. Where multiple analyte results are reported, the 'Analyte result sequence' makes the order in which they were reported explicit.</items>
                                                                        </term_definitions>
                                                                    </children>

                                        <archetype_id>
                                            <value>openEHR-EHR-OBSERVATION.laboratory_test_result.v1</value>
                                        </archetype_id>
                                        <term_definitions code="at0000">
                                            <items id="text">eGFR</items>
                                            <items id="description">The result, including findings and the laboratory's interpretation, of an investigation performed on specimens collected from an individual or related to that individual.</items>
                                        </term_definitions>
                                        <term_definitions code="at0001">
                                            <items id="text">Event Series</items>
                                            <items id="description">@ internal @</items>
                                        </term_definitions>
                                        <term_definitions code="at0002">
                                            <items id="text">Any event</items>
                                            <items id="description">Default, unspecified point in time or interval event which may be explicitly defined in a template or at run-time.</items>
                                        </term_definitions>
                                        <term_definitions code="at0003">
                                            <items id="text">Tree</items>
                                            <items id="description">@ internal @</items>
                                        </term_definitions>
                                        <term_definitions code="at0004">
                                            <items id="text">Tree</items>
                                            <items id="description">@ internal @</items>
                                        </term_definitions>
                                        <term_definitions code="at0005">
                                            <items id="text">Test name</items>
                                            <items id="description">Name of the laboratory investigation performed on the specimen(s).</items>
                                            <items id="comment">A test result may be for a single analyte, or a group of items, including panel tests. It is strongly recommended that 'Test name' be coded with a terminology, for example LOINC or SNOMED CT. For example: 'Glucose', 'Urea and Electrolytes', 'Swab', 'Cortisol (am)', 'Potassium in perspiration' or 'Melanoma histopathology'. The name may sometimes include specimen type and patient state, for example 'Fasting blood glucose' or include other information, as 'Potassium (PNA blood gas)'.</items>
                                        </term_definitions>
                                        <term_definitions code="at0017">
                                            <items id="text">Receiving laboratory</items>
                                            <items id="description">Details of the laboratory which received the request and has overall responsibility to manage reporting of the test, even if other labs perform specific aspects.</items>
                                            <items id="comment">This slot is intended to carry details of the laboratory which received the request and has overall responsibility to manage reporting of the test, even if other labs perform specific aspects.

The receiving laboratory may either perform the test or refer it to another laboratory. Where a different laboratory is responsible for performing the testing on specific analytes, it would be expected that these details would be carried in the 'Analyte result detail' SLOT within the CLUSTER.laboratory_test_analyte archetype.

</items>
                                        </term_definitions>
                                        <term_definitions code="at0035">
                                            <items id="text">Distribution list</items>
                                            <items id="description">Details of additional clinicians or organisations who require a copy of the test result.</items>
                                            <items id="comment">The 'Distribution list' is for information-only, and that the primary recipient of the report is the person intended to act on the information.</items>
                                        </term_definitions>
                                        <term_definitions code="at0037">
                                            <items id="text">Partial</items>
                                            <items id="description">This is a partial (e.g. initial, interim or preliminary) Test Result: data in the Test Result may be incomplete or unverified.</items>
                                        </term_definitions>
                                        <term_definitions code="at0038">
                                            <items id="text">Final</items>
                                            <items id="description">The Test result is complete and verified by an authorised person.</items>
                                        </term_definitions>
                                        <term_definitions code="at0040">
                                            <items id="text">Amended</items>
                                            <items id="description">The result has been modified subsequent to being Final, and is complete and verified by the responsible pathologist, and result data has been changed.</items>
                                        </term_definitions>
                                        <term_definitions code="at0057">
                                            <items id="text">Conclusion</items>
                                            <items id="description">Narrative description of the key findings.</items>
                                            <items id="comment">For example: 'Pattern suggests significant renal impairment'. The content of the conclusion will vary, depending on the investigation performed. This conclusion should be aligned with the coded 'Test diagnosis'.</items>
                                        </term_definitions>
                                        <term_definitions code="at0062">
                                            <items id="text">Requester order identifier</items>
                                            <items id="description">The local identifier assigned by the requesting clinical system.</items>
                                            <items id="comment">Equivalent to the HL7 Placer Order Identifier.</items>
                                        </term_definitions>
                                        <term_definitions code="at0063">
                                            <items id="text">Receiver order identifier</items>
                                            <items id="description">The local identifier assigned to the test order by the order filler, usually by the Laboratory Information System (LIS).</items>
                                            <items id="comment">Assigning an identifier to a request by the Laboratory lnformation System (LIS) enables tracking progress of the request and enables linking results to requests. It also provides a reference to assist with enquiries and it is usually equivalent to the HL7 Filler Order Identifier.</items>
                                        </term_definitions>
                                        <term_definitions code="at0065">
                                            <items id="text">Specimen detail</items>
                                            <items id="description">Details about the physical substance that has been analysed.</items>
                                            <items id="comment">If the specimen type is sufficiently specified with a code in the Test name, then this additional data is not required. Linking results to specific specimens may be recorded using 'Specimen identifier' elements in both the CLUSTER.specimen and the various results CLUSTER archetypes.</items>
                                        </term_definitions>
                                        <term_definitions code="at0068">
                                            <items id="text">Laboratory internal identifier</items>
                                            <items id="description">A local identifier assigned by the receiving Laboratory Information System (LIS) to track the test process.</items>
                                            <items id="comment">This identifier is an internal tracking number assigned by the LIS, and it not intended to be the name of the test.</items>
                                        </term_definitions>
                                        <term_definitions code="at0073">
                                            <items id="text">Overall test status</items>
                                            <items id="description">The status of the laboratory test result as a whole.</items>
                                            <items id="comment">The values have been specifically chosen to match those in the HL7 FHIR Diagnostic report, historically derived from HL7v2 practice. Other local codes/terms can be used via the Text 'choice'.

This element is multiple occurrence to cater for the use cases where statuses for different aspects of the result have been split into several elements.</items>
                                        </term_definitions>
                                        <term_definitions code="at0074">
                                            <items id="text">Cancelled</items>
                                            <items id="description">The result is unavailable because the test was not started or not completed (also sometimes called 'aborted').</items>
                                        </term_definitions>
                                        <term_definitions code="at0075">
                                            <items id="text">Overall test status timestamp</items>
                                            <items id="description">The date and/or time that ‘Overall test status’ was issued.</items>
                                        </term_definitions>
                                        <term_definitions code="at0077">
                                            <items id="text">Diagnostic service category</items>
                                            <items id="description">The diagnostic service or discipline that is responsible for the laboratory test result.</items>
                                            <items id="comment">This is intended to be a general categorisation and not to capture the organisational name of the laboratory. For example: anatomical pathology, immunology and transfusion medicine, medical microbiology, clinical pharmacology, medical genetics, medical biochemistry. Alternatively more granular sub categories or sub disciplines, such as endocrinology, haematology, and allergology services, may be used. This may assist clinicians in filtering between categories of results. Coding with a terminology is desirable, where possible.</items>
                                        </term_definitions>
                                        <term_definitions code="at0090">
                                            <items id="text">Requester</items>
                                            <items id="description">Details of the clinician or organisation requesting the laboratory test result.</items>
                                        </term_definitions>
                                        <term_definitions code="at0094">
                                            <items id="text">Test request details</items>
                                            <items id="description">Details about the test request.</items>
                                            <items id="comment">In most situations there is one test request and a single corresponding test result, however this repeating cluster allows for the situation where there may be multiple test requests reported using a single test result.

As an example: 'a clinician asks for blood glucose in one request and Urea/electrolytes in a second request, but the lab analyser does both and the lab wishes to report these together'.</items>
                                        </term_definitions>
                                        <term_definitions code="at0097">
                                            <items id="text">Test result</items>
                                            <items id="description">Results of the test performed on the specimen(s).</items>
                                            <items id="comment">This SLOT may carry an individual analyte, a group, panel or battery of multiple analytes, or a more complex and specific structure.</items>
                                        </term_definitions>
                                        <term_definitions code="at0098">
                                            <items id="text">Test diagnosis</items>
                                            <items id="description">Single word, phrase or brief description that represents the clinical meaning and significance of the laboratory test result.</items>
                                            <items id="comment">For example: 'Severe hepatic impairment', 'Salmonella contamination'. Coding of the diagnosis with a terminology is strongly recommended, where possible. This diagnosis should be aligned with the narrative in the 'Conclusion'.</items>
                                        </term_definitions>
                                        <term_definitions code="at0100">
                                            <items id="text">Clinical information provided</items>
                                            <items id="description">Description of clinical information available at the time of interpretation of results.</items>
                                            <items id="comment">This data element may include a link to the original clinical information provided in the test request.</items>
                                        </term_definitions>
                                        <term_definitions code="at0101">
                                            <items id="text">Comment</items>
                                            <items id="description">Additional narrative about the test result not captured in other fields.</items>
                                        </term_definitions>
                                        <term_definitions code="at0106">
                                            <items id="text">Original test requested name</items>
                                            <items id="description">Name of the original laboratory test requested.</items>
                                            <items id="comment">This data element is to be used when the test requested differs from the test actually performed by the laboratory.</items>
                                        </term_definitions>
                                        <term_definitions code="at0107">
                                            <items id="text">Registered</items>
                                            <items id="description">The existence of the test is registered in the Laboratory Information System, but there is nothing yet available.</items>
                                        </term_definitions>
                                        <term_definitions code="at0110">
                                            <items id="text">Testing details</items>
                                            <items id="description">Structured details about the method of analysis, device or interpretation used.</items>
                                            <items id="comment">For example: 'details of ELISA/nephelometry'.</items>
                                        </term_definitions>
                                        <term_definitions code="at0111">
                                            <items id="text">Point-of-care test</items>
                                            <items id="description">This indicates whether the test was performed directly at Point-of-Care (POCT) as opposed to a formal result from a laboratory or other service delivery organisation.</items>
                                            <items id="comment">True if the test was performed directly at Point-of-Care (POCT).</items>
                                        </term_definitions>
                                        <term_definitions code="at0112">
                                            <items id="text">Tree</items>
                                            <items id="description">@ internal @</items>
                                        </term_definitions>
                                        <term_definitions code="at0113">
                                            <items id="text">Confounding factors</items>
                                            <items id="description">Issues or circumstances that impact on the accurate interpretation of the measurement or test result.</items>
                                            <items id="comment">'Confounding factors' should be reserved for uncontrolled/unplanned issues of patient state/physiology that might affect interpretation, for example 'recent exercise' or 'recent tobacco smoking'.

Known or required preconditions, such as 'fasting' should be carried in the 'Sampling conditions' element within the CLUSTER.specimen archetype . In some cases preconditions are captured as part of the test name, for example 'Fasting blood glucose'.

Known issues with specimen collection or handling, such as 'prolonged use of tourniquet' or 'sample haemolysed', should be carried in the 'Specimen quality' elements within CLUSTER.specimen archetype.

Coding with a terminology is desirable, where possible.</items>
                                        </term_definitions>
                                        <term_definitions code="at0114">
                                            <items id="text">Structured confounding factors</items>
                                            <items id="description">Details of issues or circumstances that impact on the accurate interpretation of the measurement or test result.</items>
                                            <items id="comment">For example: Last Normal Menstrual Period (LNMP).</items>
                                        </term_definitions>
                                        <term_definitions code="at0115">
                                            <items id="text">Corrected</items>
                                            <items id="description">The result has been modified subsequent to being Final, and is complete and verified by the responsible pathologist. This is a sub-category of 'Amended'.</items>
                                        </term_definitions>
                                        <term_definitions code="at0116">
                                            <items id="text">Entered in error</items>
                                            <items id="description">The Test Result has been withdrawn following previous Final release.</items>
                                        </term_definitions>
                                        <term_definitions code="at0117">
                                            <items id="text">Extension</items>
                                            <items id="description">Additional information required to capture local content or to align with other reference models/formalisms.</items>
                                            <items id="comment">For example: local information requirements or additional metadata to align with FHIR or CIMI equivalents.</items>
                                        </term_definitions>
                                        <term_definitions code="at0118">
                                            <items id="text">Multimedia representation</items>
                                            <items id="description">Digital image, video or diagram representing the test result.</items>
                                            <items id="comment">Multiple formats are allowed but they should represent equivalent clinical content.</items>
                                        </term_definitions>
                                        <term_definitions code="at0119">
                                            <items id="text">Appended</items>
                                            <items id="description">Subsequent to being final, the report has been modified by adding new content. The existing content is unchanged. This is a sub-category of 'Amended'.</items>
                                        </term_definitions>
                                        <term_definitions code="at0120">
                                            <items id="text">Preliminary</items>
                                            <items id="description">Verified early results are available, but not all results are final. This is a sub-category of 'Partial'.</items>
                                        </term_definitions>
                                        <term_definitions code="at0121">
                                            <items id="text">Test method</items>
                                            <items id="description">Description about the method used to perform the test.</items>
                                            <items id="comment">Coding with a terminology is desirable, where possible.</items>
                                        </term_definitions>
                                        <term_definitions code="at0122">
                                            <items id="text">Structured test diagnosis</items>
                                            <items id="description">A structured or complex diagnosis for the laboratory test.</items>
                                            <items id="comment">For example: Anatomical pathology diagnoses consisting of several different axes such as morphology, etiology and function.</items>
                                        </term_definitions>
                                    </children>

                                        <archetype_id>
                                            <value>openEHR-EHR-OBSERVATION.body_surface_area.v1</value>
                                        </archetype_id>
                                        <term_definitions code="at0000">
                                            <items id="text">Body surface area</items>
                                            <items id="description">The measured or calculated surface area of a human body.</items>
                                            <items id="comment">May also be referred to as BSA.</items>
                                        </term_definitions>
                                        <term_definitions code="at0001">
                                            <items id="text">Event Series</items>
                                            <items id="description">@ internal @</items>
                                        </term_definitions>
                                        <term_definitions code="at0002">
                                            <items id="text">Any event</items>
                                            <items id="description">Default, unspecified point in time or interval event which may be explicitly defined in a template or at run-time.</items>
                                        </term_definitions>
                                        <term_definitions code="at0003">
                                            <items id="text">Tree</items>
                                            <items id="description">@ internal @</items>
                                        </term_definitions>
                                        <term_definitions code="at0004">
                                            <items id="text">Body Surface Area</items>
                                            <items id="description">The measured or calculated surface area of a human body.</items>
                                            <items id="comment">For example: '1.81 m2'</items>
                                        </term_definitions>
                                        <term_definitions code="at0005">
                                            <items id="text">Tree</items>
                                            <items id="description">@ internal @</items>
                                        </term_definitions>
                                        <term_definitions code="at0006">
                                            <items id="text">Formula</items>
                                            <items id="description">Formula used to calculate the BSA.</items>
                                            <items id="comment">For example: Mosteller, DuBois and DuBois, Haycock and Boyd.</items>
                                        </term_definitions>
                                        <term_definitions code="at0007">
                                            <items id="text">Extension</items>
                                            <items id="description">Additional information required to capture local content or to align with other reference models/formalisms.</items>
                                            <items id="comment">For example: local information requirements or additional metadata to align with FHIR or CIMI equivalents.</items>
                                        </term_definitions>
                                        <term_definitions code="at0008">
                                            <items id="text">Device</items>
                                            <items id="description">The device used to measure or estimate the body surface area.</items>
                                        </term_definitions>
                                        <term_definitions code="at0009">
                                            <items id="text">Method</items>
                                            <items id="description">The method by which the body surface area was entered into the clinical system.</items>
                                        </term_definitions>
                                        <term_definitions code="at0010">
                                            <items id="text">System entry</items>
                                            <items id="description">The Area was entered automatically by the clinical system and without manual intervention of the clinician.</items>
                                        </term_definitions>
                                        <term_definitions code="at0011">
                                            <items id="text">Manual entry</items>
                                            <items id="description">The Area was entered manually by the clinician.</items>
                                        </term_definitions>
                                        <term_definitions code="at0012">
                                            <items id="text">Dubois and Dubois</items>
                                            <items id="description">The Dubois and Dubois formula was used to calculate the body surface area.</items>
                                        </term_definitions>
                                        <term_definitions code="at0013">
                                            <items id="text">Mosteller</items>
                                            <items id="description">The Mosteller formula was used to calculate the body surface area.</items>
                                        </term_definitions>
                                        <term_definitions code="at0014">
                                            <items id="text">Haycock</items>
                                            <items id="description">The Haycock formula was used to calculate the body surface area.</items>
                                        </term_definitions>
                                        <term_definitions code="at0015">
                                            <items id="text">Gehan and George</items>
                                            <items id="description">The Gehan and George formula was used to calculate the body surface area.</items>
                                        </term_definitions>
                                        <term_definitions code="at0016">
                                            <items id="text">Boyd</items>
                                            <items id="description">The Boyd formula was used to calculate the body surface area.</items>
                                        </term_definitions>
                                        <term_definitions code="at0017">
                                            <items id="text">Fujimoto</items>
                                            <items id="description">The Fujimoto formula was used to calculate the body surface area.</items>
                                        </term_definitions>
                                        <term_definitions code="at0018">
                                            <items id="text">Takihara</items>
                                            <items id="description">The Takihara formula was used to calculate the body surface area.</items>
                                        </term_definitions>
                                        <term_definitions code="at0019">
                                            <items id="text">Comment</items>
                                            <items id="description">Additional narrative about the measurement, not captured in other fields.</items>
                                        </term_definitions>
                                        <term_definitions code="at0020">
                                            <items id="text">Tree</items>
                                            <items id="description">@ internal @</items>
                                        </term_definitions>
                                        <term_definitions code="at0021">
                                            <items id="text">Confounding factors</items>
                                            <items id="description">Record of any issues or factors that may impact on the measurement or calculation of body surface area.</items>
                                            <items id="comment">For example: noting limb amputation; or skin diseases.</items>
                                        </term_definitions>
                                        <term_definitions code="m2">
                                            <items id="text">m²</items>
                                            <items id="description">square meter</items>
                                        </term_definitions>

                                                <archetype_id>
                                                    <value>openEHR-EHR-CLUSTER.medication_supply_amount.v0</value>
                                                </archetype_id>
                                                <term_definitions code="at0000">
                                                    <items id="text">Dose given</items>
                                                    <items id="description">Details related to the amount of a medication, vaccine or other therapeutic item to be supplied or supplied to the patient, as part of authorisation, dispensing or administration.</items>
                                                </term_definitions>
                                                <term_definitions code="at0131">
                                                    <items id="text">Dose given</items>
                                                    <items id="description">The amount of medication, vaccine or therapeutic good intended to be supplied or actually supplied.</items>
                                                    <items id="comment">For example: 1, 1.5, or 0.125.</items>
                                                </term_definitions>
                                                <term_definitions code="at0142">
                                                    <items id="text">Duration of supply</items>
                                                    <items id="description">The period of time for which the medication should be dispensed or for which a suppy was dispensed.</items>
                                                    <items id="comment">The dispenser is asked to supply sufficient quantity of medication to cover the defined period.</items>
                                                </term_definitions>
                                                <term_definitions code="at0147">
                                                    <items id="text">Units</items>
                                                    <items id="description">The dose unit or pack unit associated with the dispense amount.</items>
                                                    <items id="comment">For example: 'tablets', 'packs', ml'.</items>
                                                </term_definitions>
                                                <term_definitions code="at0158">
                                                    <items id="text">Number of packs</items>
                                                    <items id="description">The number of packs specified by the prescriber or dispensed by the dispenser.</items>
                                                </term_definitions>
                                                <term_definitions code="at0159">
                                                    <items id="text">Pack size</items>
                                                    <items id="description">The pack size specifed by the prescriber or dispensed by the dispenser.</items>
                                                    <items id="comment">For example: '300', '28'.</items>
                                                </term_definitions>
                                                <term_definitions code="at0160">
                                                    <items id="text">Pack units</items>
                                                    <items id="description">The units of measurement associated with pack size.</items>
                                                    <items id="comment">For example: 'tabs', 'mls'.</items>
                                                </term_definitions>
                                                <term_definitions code="at0161">
                                                    <items id="text">Dispensed duration</items>
                                                    <items id="description">A narrative representation of the amount The amount of medication, vaccine or therapeutic good intended to be supplied or actually supplied.</items>
                                                </term_definitions>

                                                <archetype_id>
                                                    <value>openEHR-EHR-CLUSTER.dosage.v1</value>
                                                </archetype_id>
                                                <term_definitions code="at0000">
                                                    <items id="text">Original Dosage</items>
                                                    <items id="description">The combination of a medication amount and administration timing for a single day, in the context of a medication order or medication management.</items>
                                                    <items id="comment">For example: '2 tablets at 6pm' or '20mg three times per day'. Please note: this cluster allows multiple occurrences to enable representation of a complete set of dose patterns for a single dose direction.</items>
                                                </term_definitions>
                                                <term_definitions code="at0037">
                                                    <items id="text">Daily timing</items>
                                                    <items id="description">Structured details about the timing pattern for a single day.</items>
                                                    <items id="comment">For example: 'in the morning', 'at 0600, 1400, 2100'.</items>
                                                </term_definitions>
                                                <term_definitions code="at0102">
                                                    <items id="text">Administration duration</items>
                                                    <items id="description">The period of time over which a single dose of the medication or vaccine should be administered.</items>
                                                    <items id="comment">For example: 'Administer over 10 minutes'.</items>
                                                </term_definitions>
                                                <term_definitions code="at0134">
                                                    <items id="text">Administration rate</items>
                                                    <items id="description">The rate at which the medication, such as an infusion, is to be administered.</items>
                                                    <items id="comment">For example: '200 ml/h'. Use the text data type to record non- or semi-quantifiable instructions.</items>
                                                </term_definitions>
                                                <term_definitions code="at0135">
                                                    <items id="text">Dose formula</items>
                                                    <items id="description">The formula used to calculate the dose amount or administration rate where this is dependent on some other factor, such as body weight or surface area.</items>
                                                    <items id="comment">For example: '10mg/kg/day'. The result of this formula would normally be held in Dose amount/unit or Administration rate/duration. Where clinical measurements such as body weight is used in the dose calculation, a LINK attribute should used to specify which particular measurement has been used.</items>
                                                </term_definitions>
                                                <term_definitions code="at0144">
                                                    <items id="text">Dose</items>
                                                    <items id="description">The value of the amount of medication administered at one time, as a real number, or range of real numbers, and associated with the Dose unit.</items>
                                                    <items id="comment">For example: 1, 1.5, 0.125 or 1-2, 12.5-20.5</items>
                                                </term_definitions>
                                                <term_definitions code="at0145">
                                                    <items id="text">Unit of measure</items>
                                                    <items id="description">The unit which is associated with the Dose amount.</items>
                                                    <items id="comment">For example: 'tablet','mg'. Coding of the dose unit with a terminology is preferred, where possible.</items>
                                                </term_definitions>
                                                <term_definitions code="at0164">
                                                    <items id="text">Dosage sequence</items>
                                                    <items id="description">The intended position of this dosage within the overall sequence of dosages.</items>
                                                    <items id="comment">For example: '1', '2', '3'. 
Where multiple dosages are expressed, the 'Pattern sequence' makes the order in which they should be executed explicit. For example: (1) 1 tab in the morning, (2) 2 tab at 2pm, (3) 1 tab at night.</items>
                                                </term_definitions>
                                                <term_definitions code="at0176">
                                                    <items id="text">Alternate dose amount</items>
                                                    <items id="description">An alternate representation of the value of the amount of medication administered at one time, as a real number, or range of real numbers, and associated with the Dose unit.</items>
                                                    <items id="comment">For example, can be used to represent a unit-dose based value such as 'tabs', when the Dose amount is expressed as an SI unit such as 'mg', or where it is required to express the total amount of an infusion as well as the dose amount of the active ingredient.</items>
                                                </term_definitions>
                                                <term_definitions code="at0177">
                                                    <items id="text">Alternate dose unit</items>
                                                    <items id="description">The unit which is associated with the Alternate dose amount.</items>
                                                </term_definitions>
                                                <term_definitions code="at0178">
                                                    <items id="text">Detail</items>
                                                    <items id="description">Text description of the dose.</items>
                                                    <items id="comment">For example: "Apply ointment to affected area until it glistens". This element is intended to allow implementers to use the structures for increasing/tapering dosages without necessarily specifying the doses in a structured way.</items>
                                                </term_definitions>
                                            </children>
